org.ow2.chameleon.core.activators

Class BundleDeployer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ow2.chameleon.core.services.AbstractDeployer
      • org.ow2.chameleon.core.activators.BundleDeployer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.osgi.framework.BundleActivator, Deployer

    public class BundleDeployer
extends AbstractDeployer
implements org.osgi.framework.BundleActivator
    Deployer installing and starting bundles.
    Version:
    $Id: 1.0.4 $Id
    Author:
    The OW2 Chameleon Team

      • accept

        public boolean accept(File file)
        Does the current deployer accept the given file. The accept method must not check file existence, as it may disable notification on file deletion.
        Specified by:
        accept in interface Deployer
        Parameters:
        file - the file
        Returns:
        true if the file is accepted by the current deployer, false otherwise

      • onFileCreate

        Callback called when an accepted file is created.
        Specified by:

        Overrides:

        Parameters:

      • tryToStartUnstartedBundles

        private void tryToStartUnstartedBundles(org.osgi.framework.Bundle bundle)
        Iterates over the set of bundles and try to start unstarted bundles. This method is called when holding the monitor lock.
        Parameters:
        bundle - the installed bundle triggering this attempt.

      • open

        public void open(Collection<File> files)
        Method called when the deployer is initialized. This method is called once per monitored directory, with a potentially empty set of files (if there are no file or if the directory does not contain any accepted file)

        It's a good practice to install all bundles and then start them. This method cannot be interrupted.

        Specified by:
        open in interface Deployer
        Overrides:
        open in class AbstractDeployer
        Parameters:
        files - the set of accepted file currently present is a monitored directory.

      • onFileDelete

        public void onFileDelete(File file)
        Callback called when an accepted file is deleted.
        Specified by:
        onFileDelete in interface Deployer
        Overrides:
        onFileDelete in class AbstractDeployer
        Parameters:
        file - the file
